This unconventional behavior continues in Chapter 15, where Captain Scottie only occasionally emerges to check on the situation. As a result, passengers begin to complain about the prolonged voyage. corrupted_reasoning: This corrupted fact contradicts the information provided in Chapters 14 and 15, which show Gissing's leadership as unconventional and leading to passenger complaints rather than praise.
